task:
The Metadata function is still only producing the Long Form title and only giving one option.  It says it is scoring it but shows (/10) 

It should also produce some Metadata for Shorts on the topic.  Can you review the prompt that is sent to OpenAI with this function?

plan.planText: Investigate the function responsible for generating metadata, specifically its prompt construction to OpenAI. Identify where the prompt for the Metadata function is created and modify it to produce not only the Long Form title with scoring, but also metadata options for Shorts on the same topic. Refactor or enhance the prompt to ask for multiple options and include scores properly. Update the part of the code that handles the OpenAI prompt to ensure it yields the expected output.

files.reason: Likely contains the backend function that constructs and sends the metadata prompt to OpenAI, since this is a Python app and server.py usually handles server logic.
files.changeSummary: Update the OpenAI prompt in the metadata function to request additional Shorts metadata and correctly handle scoring for multiple options.
files.subtaskPrompt: Find the function in server.py that generates metadata by sending a prompt to OpenAI. Modify the OpenAI prompt to produce multiple metadata options including Shorts on the topic, and ensure the scoring (/10) is included for each. Adjust parsing as necessary to handle multiple outputs.

files.reason: The metadata output is probably displayed in this detailed project page, so we may need to adapt UI code to handle multiple metadata options if changed.
files.changeSummary: Adjust the UI rendering logic to display multiple metadata options for both Long Form and Shorts, including their scores.
files.subtaskPrompt: Edit the ProjectDetail.jsx file to update the display logic of metadata results for a project. Make sure it can render multiple metadata options with scores, including metadata related to Shorts.

planText: Investigate the function responsible for generating metadata, specifically its prompt construction to OpenAI. Identify where the prompt for the Metadata function is created and modify it to produce not only the Long Form title with scoring, but also metadata options for Shorts on the same topic. Refactor or enhance the prompt to ask for multiple options and include scores properly. Update the part of the code that handles the OpenAI prompt to ensure it yields the expected output.

task: You are working inside an existing Replit web project. Add a new “Aircraft Tax Benefit Calculator” as a separate page within the current site. Do NOT create a standalone app. Reuse the site’s existing

plan.planText: Add a new Aircraft Tax Benefit Calculator as an integrated page in the existing React Router app. Reuse AppLayout, Tailwind, and shadcn/ui. Introduce a pure calculation library with conservative defaults. Register a new route at /tools/aircraft-tax, render a wizard style UI on a single page, show results inline, and include required disclaimers. Avoid changes to auth, server, or build configuration.

files.reason: This file defines React Router routes and must register the new calculator page within the existing layout.
files.changeSummary: Import the AircraftTaxCalculator page and add a new route at /tools/aircraft-tax wrapped in AppLayout.
files.subtaskPrompt: Add an import for AircraftTaxCalculator and register a new <Route> at path /tools/aircraft-tax using AppLayout, without modifying existing routes.

files.reason: This is the new page entry point that hosts the calculator and disclaimer inside the existing page shell.
files.changeSummary: Create a new page component with header, disclaimer alert, and placeholder for the wizard and results.
files.subtaskPrompt: Create this new page component using shadcn Card and Alert, include the required disclaimer text, and leave a mount point for the wizard component.

files.reason: A self contained wizard component is needed to manage steps, branching, and state without affecting other pages.
files.changeSummary: Implement the wizard controller with step state, branching based on Step 1, and submission handling.
files.subtaskPrompt: Create a wizard component that renders step components conditionally, manages local state with useState, and calls the calculation library on submit.

files.reason: Results must be displayed on the same page after calculation, with summaries, warnings, and export.
files.changeSummary: Render calculation outputs, warnings, breakdown sections, and an Export JSON button.
files.subtaskPrompt: Build a results panel using shadcn Cards, Alerts, and Accordions that accepts calculation results as props and supports JSON export.

files.reason: Shared types are required to keep calculations pure and UI wiring safe.
files.changeSummary: Define input, assumption, and result TypeScript interfaces and enums.
files.subtaskPrompt: Add strict TypeScript types for use cases, inputs, assumptions, and calculation results with no React imports.

files.reason: Depreciation logic must be isolated and testable as pure functions.
files.changeSummary: Implement basis and first year depreciation calculations with conservative defaults.
files.subtaskPrompt: Add pure functions to compute basis and first year depreciation based on bonus and MACRS assumptions.

files.reason: Passive loss and excess business loss logic must be encapsulated separately for clarity and testing.
files.changeSummary: Implement passive loss absorption and EBL limiter helpers.
files.subtaskPrompt: Create pure helper functions that apply passive income limits and optional excess business loss limits.

files.reason: A single export surface simplifies imports for UI components.
files.changeSummary: Re export all calculation modules from one entry file.
files.subtaskPrompt: Export all types and calculation helpers from this index file.

planText: Add a new Aircraft Tax Benefit Calculator as an integrated page in the existing React Router app. Reuse AppLayout, Tailwind, and shadcn/ui. Introduce a pure calculation library with conservative defaults. Register a new route at /tools/aircraft-tax, render a wizard style UI on a single page, show results inline, and include required disclaimers. Avoid changes to auth, server, or build configuration.
